abstract: Officials in Berkeley, Calif, say balcony that collapsed and left six people dead was supported by wooden beams that were extensively rotted due to water damage; are recommending additional regulations for city's building codes.
lead_paragraph: While inspectors did not explicitly say that rotted beams caused the collapse, they recommended adding more regulations to the city’s building code to protect balconies from moisture.

headline.main: Report Cites Dry-Rotting in Collapse of Balcony in Berkeley
headline.print_headline: Report Cites Dry-Rotting in Collapse of Balcony

snippet: While inspectors did not explicitly say that rotted beams caused the collapse, they recommended adding more regulations to the city’s building code to protect balconies from moisture.
